messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On March 7, DET. N. V. Grayson responded to an alarm at the Westfield Jewelry Store. Key witnesses included Mr. Lopez, the store owner, and Ms. Turner, a pedestrian. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. E. B. Monroe - OPERATIONS Det. Grayson, Jr. .. INVESTIGATIONS DAWSON 17:15 Burglary Mr. Lopez reported several missing diamond necklaces, while Ms. Turner described a masked individual fleeing the scene. Watch. Technician Dale gathered shards of broken glass for analysis. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Grayson Jr OPERATIONS Lt. Monroe INFORMANT Turner, Jane 29 Cedar Avenue, Westfield, Ohio 132-450. 91465. DAWSON 17:15 Burglary By 11:00 AM, Detective Grayson and Lieutenant Monroe reviewed CCTV footage, pinpointing a possible suspect vehicle. Captain A. L. Reed suggested a city-wide alert. Sergeant D. F. Wallace is coordinating with nearby pawn shops for potential sales of the stolen items. At 12:30 PM, an inventory of all stolen jewelry was provided by Mr. Lopez. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Grayson Jr Lt. Monroe AFFIDAVIT - Burglary Report 1) CCTV Clips 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Jewelry Descriptions 5) Store Entry Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE K. Baxter W.P.D. 8.70 P26 1085 Lopez, RICARDO NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 70-1347 DETECTIVE: N. GRAYSON ITEM: 26-4352- 85 CRIME: 17:15 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 81130 - CONFIRMED Jane Doe DATE 9/15/22 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. N. V. Grayson  Officer Context: On March 7, DET. N. V. Grayson responded to an alarm at the Westfield Jewelry Store. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. E. B. Monroe  Officer Context: Lt. E. B. Monroe - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Technician Dale  Officer Context: Watch. Technician Dale gathered shards of broken glass for analysis. Officer Role: Technician Officer Name: Detective Grayson  Officer Context: By 11:00 AM, Detective Grayson and Lieutenant Monroe reviewed CCTV footage. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain A. L. Reed  Officer Context: Captain A. L. Reed suggested a city-wide alert. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant D. F. Wallace  Officer Context: Sergeant D. F. Wallace is coordinating with nearby pawn shops for potential sales of the stolen items. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Lieutenant Monroe  Officer Context: By 11:00 AM, Detective Grayson and Lieutenant Monroe reviewed CCTV footage. Officer Role: Lieutenant
